_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Paneldactyl
author: Matheusn.biolowons@gmail.com
description:
ðŸ’Ž Egg: Paneldactyl
âš™ï¸ Version: 1.3
What is it: An easy and practical way to test other panels. With this Egg, you can install a Pterodactyl/Jexactyl panel on your own panel, literally a Panel inside another Panel (Panel only, Wings is for another Egg, if I can manage).
Bug fixes/changelogs:
 - (1.0) Release.
 - (1.0) Ability to run subcommands in the terminal (composer, setup, database, migrate, user, build, reinstall).
 - (1.0) System that checks "file integrity" (reinstalls if something is not installed).
 - (1.0) Possibility to build the panel (better for those who want to create their own themes/customizations).
 - (1.0) System that checks if the Egg is up to date.
 - (1.0) Everything is done via scripts, for better maintenance and updating.
 - (1.1) Added developer mode.
 - (1.1) Possibility to clone Dashboards directly from GitHub (Public/Private).
    ðŸ“ Variables: 
        - (1.0) Version.
        - (1.0) Panel `(Pterodactyl, Jexactyl, Jexactyl Brasil)`.
        - (1.0) Update warnings.
        - (1.1) Developer Mode
        - (1.1) GIT repository URL
        - (1.1) Choose the branch
        - (1.1) Git Username
        - (1.1) Git Access Token
        - (1.1) Change in the installation script.
        - (1.3) Change nodejs version management to NVM
    Docker: 
         - ARM64, ARM, 64x compatibility
âš ï¸ Attention:
   â—ï¸ A database is required.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Ashu11-A/Ashu_eggs/main/Connect/en/Paneldactyl/start.sh -o start.sh
chmod a+x ./start.sh
if [ ! -d './logs' ]; then
mkdir logs
fi
echo "1.3" > logs/egg_version
echo "source /home/container/.nvm/nvm.sh" > /etc/profile.d/nvm.sh
echo "source /home/container/.nvm/nvm.sh" > /mnt/server/.bashrc
chmod +x /etc/profile.d/nvm.sh

variables.name: Version
variables.description: Panel version. `latest` will install the most recent version.

variables.name: Panel
variables.description: Choose which panel the Egg will install. Currently, there are these 3 options: Pterodactyl, Jexactyl, Jexactyl Brasil

variables.name: Update Warnings
variables.description: Enable/Disable Egg update notifications in the terminal.

variables.name: Developer Mode
variables.description: Enable this if you are using this Egg to develop a theme/customization. This command will run: Composer, Migrate, Permissions every time the Egg starts. (Build is not on the list as it consumes a lot of computing power and can often be unnecessary).

variables.name: GIT Repository URL
variables.description:
GitHub Repo to clone. Use only if you want to clone your own panel.

EX: https://github.com/Ashu11-A/repo_name

variables.name: Choose Branch
variables.description:
Which branch to pull from Github.

The default is blank to pull the default branch from the repo.

variables.name: Git Access Token
variables.description:
Password to use with Git.

It is best practice to use a Personal Access Token.
https://github.com/settings/tokens
https://gitlab.com/-/profile/personal_access_tokens
